om.tnavigator
Class NavigatorServlet

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          om.tnavigator.NavigatorServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class NavigatorServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

Om test navigator; implementation of the test delivery engine.

See Also:
Serialized Form

serveTestContent

public void serveTestContent(UserSession us,
                             java.lang.String sTitle,
                             java.lang.String sAuxTitle,
                             java.lang.String sTip,
                             java.lang.String sProgressInfo,
                             java.lang.String sXHTML,
                             boolean bIncludeNav,
                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                             boolean bClearCSS)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Serves a test content page to the user, including navigation.

Parameters:
us - Session
sTitle - Page main title
sAuxTitle - Auxiliary title (use "" if not needed)
sTip - Text that appears as tooltip on main heading (null if none)
sProgressInfo - Text that appears where question progress info is shown.
sXHTML - XHTML content of main part of page
bIncludeNav - If true, includes the question numbers etc.
request - HTTP request
response - HTTP response
bClearCSS - True if CSS should be cleared before serving this page
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Any error in serving page

                                        boolean singleQuestionMode,

                                 throws XMLException
Parameters:
plainMode - whether we are in plain mode.
singleQuestionMode - whether we are in single question mode.
removeQuestionCss - whether to remove the question stylesheet link.
Returns:
the appropriate template for a page, based on the parameters.
Throws:
XMLException

sendError

public void sendError(UserSession us,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                      int code,
                      boolean isBug,
                      boolean keepSession,
                      java.lang.String backToTest,
                      java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.Throwable exception)
               throws om.tnavigator.NavigatorServlet.StopException
Sends an error to the student, logs it, and kills their session. Does not return but throws a StopException in order to abort further processing.

Parameters:
us - Session to be killed (null if we should keep it)
request - HTTP request
response - HTTP response
code - Desired HTTP status code; HttpServletResponse.SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR is treated differently in that these are logged as errors, not warnings
isBug - Set true if this is a bug and should be logged as such, complete with the option for users to re-enter test. Generally I have erred on the side of setting this true...
keepSession - normally, this should be false, and OM will throw away the user's session in case it was corrupted in a way that caused the error. Then on the next request it will silently give them a new session. But very occasionally we don't want this behaviour in which case this parameter can be set to true.
backToTest - If set to test ID (not null), this forces the back-to-test option to appear.
title - Title of message
message - Actual message
exception - Any exception that should be reported (null if none)
Throws:
StopException - Always, to abort processing
om.tnavigator.NavigatorServlet.StopException
